artefact.overview: How to report environmental incidents to the Environment Agency
artefact.body:
Call the Environment Agency on 0800 80 70 60 to report environmental incidents.

You should call the Environment Agency to report:

  • damage or danger to the natural environment
  • pollution to water or land
  • poaching or illegal fishing
  • fish in distress or dead fish
  • watercourses blocked by a vehicle or fallen tree causing risk of flooding
  • illegal dumping of hazardous waste or large amounts of industrial waste
  • incidents at Environment Agency-regulated waste sites
  • illegal removals from watercourses
  • unusual changes in river flow
  • collapsed or badly damaged river or canal banks

Incidents you should report to local councils and utility companies

For the following incidents, see the separate guidance to find out whether you should notify your local council or the utility company:

  • burst water mains
  • noise
  • waste
  • pest nuisances
  • discarded syringes
  • dangerous buildings or structures
